en: The online video has now had more than twelve thousand hits. If only your books could sell as quickly.
zh: 現在網路視頻的點擊量已經超過12000次了，要是你的書也能賣得這麼快就好了。

en: Ha funny.
zh: 「哈哈，有趣。」

en: God loves everybody—but even he thinks this shmuck is an asswhole.
zh: 「神愛世人，即使神覺得這個人是個渾蛋。」

en: These kinds of comments have always made you fearful of where the world is going.
zh: 這些評論總是使你惶恐不安，你不知道這世界將會變成什麼樣子。

en: You worry one day people will have the courage to say in the real world what they can now only say anonymously through social media.
zh: 你擔心有一天人們會敢於在現實世界說出只能通過社交媒體以匿名方式所說的話來。

en: Since writing those comments down in the Madness Journal (no cutting and pasting here, Jerry), the hit count has gone up another thousand.
zh: 在「狂人日記」里寫下那些評論后（這裏可沒有剪切和粘貼哦，傑瑞），視頻點擊量又上升了1000。

en: At this rate every single living person in the world will have seen it by Christmas, unless some celebrity kills somebody or flashes their junk to the media.
zh: 按照這個速度，世上每一個人都將在聖誕節看到它，除非有某個名流殺死某人，或向媒體曝光醜聞。

en: Hard to know whether it’s crashing what’s left of my career or helping it.
zh: 不知道這是否會毀掉我的事業，還是幫助我更加飛黃騰達。

en: We need to talk, she said.
zh: 「我們需要談談。」她說。

en: I’m really sorry, Sandra.
zh: 「真的很抱歉，桑德拉。

en: I feel so ashamed and— How could you, Jerry?
zh: 我覺得很慚愧，而且——」「你怎麼可以這樣，傑瑞？

en: And I don’t just mean how could you say those things, but how could you think them?
zh: 你怎麼能說出那種話來，你到底是怎麼想的？」

en: She was crying.
zh: 她哭了。

en: Tears are what Henry used to think of as emotional blackmail.
zh: 亨利認為眼淚是進行情感敲詐的利器。

en: Many of his female characters used them to get their way (you really are a chauvinistic pig, Henry), and all you could do was tell her how sorry you were, over and over, but being sorry wasn’t going to fix it.
zh: 他的許多女性人物為了達到目的不惜使用這個利器（你真是一個大男子主義者，亨利），你所能做的就是跟她說「對不起」，反反覆復地說「對不起」，但僅僅說「對不起」也於事無補。

en: You were forming a plan—Henry can tell you.
zh: 你正醞釀著一個計劃，亨利可以告訴你。

en: Jerry was going to get his gun. Jerry was going to shoot the son of a bitch who put that video up online.
zh: 傑瑞準備去取槍，打算把那個將視頻傳到網上的渾蛋打死。

en: Then Jerry was going to shoot himself too.
zh: 然後，傑瑞會飲彈自盡。

en: Thanks, Henry.
zh: 謝謝你，亨利。

en: Do you really think those things? Sandra asked.
zh: 「你真的是那樣想嗎？」桑德拉問。

en: You wanted to say no.
zh: 你想說「不」。

en: The word even formed in your mind, this little word so big and powerful, too big it got stuck, too big it was crushed under its own weight. Yes, you said.
zh: 你心裏想說的是這個詞，但是這麼個小小的詞太巨大、太有力了，它卡在了你的喉嚨里，壓垮了你的身體。

en: And I don’t blame you, I really don’t.
zh: 「是的。」你說，「但我不是在怪你，我真的不是在怪你。」

en: If this had been a book or a movie Sandra would have realized what she had done and gasped and apologized, and in the end you’d have made up.
zh: 如果這是一本書或一部電影，桑德拉會知道自己做了什麼，喘一口氣，道歉。最後你打定主意。

en: It would have been the ultimate rom-com: you being put through the wringer, your relationship being pulled apart from every direction near the end of the second act, but all would have been saved late in the third. If only.
zh: 這終究是浪漫喜劇：這可把你害得夠慘的，你們的關係會在第二幕結束時分崩離析，但會在第三幕得以破鏡重圓。

en: She slapped you again, this time much harder.
zh: 她又扇了你一巴掌，這一次力道更猛。

en: Act three was going to be tough work to come back from this, and you realized this is why rom-com writers don’t throw a hilarious dose of Alzheimer’s into the rom-com mix. You think I’m a whore.
zh: 現在若想在第三幕里破鏡重圓恐怕非常棘手了，你意識到這就是浪漫喜劇作家在喜劇中不隨便採用滑稽的阿爾茨海默病元素的原因所在。

en: No, it’s not that— Then what?
zh: 「不，不是——」「那是什麼呢？」

en: she asked.
zh: 她問。

en: I know you’ve been sleeping with the baker.
zh: 「我知道你已經和那個麵包師上過床了。」

en: What?
zh: 「什麼？」

en: And the guys who put in the alarms.
zh: 「還有那些安裝報警器的傢伙。

en: You must really hate me to think that way, she said.
zh: 「既然你這麼想，那你一定很恨我。」

en: Have you always thought these things?
zh: 她說，「你一直在想這些事情嗎？」

en: Only since you started sleeping around, you said.
zh: 「只是從你開始胡亂搞以後。」你說。

en: It’s this . . . this . . . disease, she said, spitting out the words. It gives you carte blanche, doesn’t it?
zh: 「是這個……這個……病，」她叫嚷著，「你覺得這個病給了你特權，是吧？

en: You can say what you want and you don’t have to own it because it’s not Jerry, it’s his bloody Alzheimer’s, but you have to own this one because half the world has already seen it.
zh: 你想說什麼就胡亂說什麼，說完了又不承認，因為說那些話的不是傑瑞，是該死的阿爾茨海默病。可是這次你必須承認，世界上一大半的人都看到了。

en: You became a laughingstock tonight, Jerry, you embarrassed yourself and you humiliated me and you ruined Eva’s wedding.
zh: 你成了今晚的笑柄，傑瑞，你不僅讓自己難堪，羞辱我，你還毀了伊娃的婚禮。

en: I know you’re sick, I know things aren’t the same, but how am I supposed to forgive you for this?
zh: 我知道你生病了，我知道情況不一樣，但我怎麼能原諒你？」

en: Now she was the one who looked like she had been slapped. My fault?
zh: 此刻她看上去像是剛才被人扇了耳光似的：「我的錯？」

en: If you hadn’t been cheating on me none of this would have happened.
zh: 「如果你沒有欺騙我，所有的這一切都不會發生。」

en: She burst into tears and ran out of the room.
zh: 她淚流滿面地跑出了房間。

en: Good news—there is none.
zh: 好消息：沒有好消息。

en: Bad news—you’re probably in your final few days at home now.
zh: 壞消息：這可能是你待在家裡的最後幾天了。

en: Your wife can’t handle the truth (what movie is that from?), and the hit count of you ruining Eva’s wedding just topped thirty thousand.
zh: 你妻子不能分辨真相（這出自哪部電影？），你破壞伊娃婚禮的視頻點擊次數剛剛突破三萬。

en: Good news.
zh: 好消息：

en: You have two unopened bottles of gin with your name on them.
zh: 你有兩瓶未開封的杜松子酒，酒瓶上寫有你的名字。

en: Hans’s house is twenty years old, a single-story brick home with a neat and tidy yard on a neat and tidy street, a pleasant-looking area in which Jerry can’t imagine Hans fitting in too well.
zh: 漢斯家的房子有二十多年的歷史了，這是一幢單層磚房，附帶一個乾淨整潔的花園，坐落在一條同樣乾淨整潔的街道上。傑瑞覺得漢斯與周邊的環境好不搭調，他的文身使他顯得格格不入。

en: But then again he’s never been one for company.
zh: 不過話又說回來，他向來就是個不合群的人。

en: Hans has had a few girlfriends come into his life, girls with sultry smiles and big tattoos.
zh: 漢斯曾有過幾個女朋友，那些女孩也有著大片的文身，個個都風情萬種。

en: But just as easily they’d drift away and move on to bigger or lesser things, drugs or booze or a different bad boy on the path to aging fast.
zh: 但是她們後來都與他漸行漸遠，因為或大或小的事情離他而去，譬如嗑藥啦、酗酒啦或遇見更成熟的壞小子。

en: Hans has always been one to move on as well, literally moving to a different house every two or three years.
zh: 漢斯一直以來就是一個漂泊不定的男人，每隔兩三年搬一次家。

en: Hans pulls the car into the garage and uses the remote to close the door behind them, putting them into darkness.
zh: 漢斯把車開進車庫，用遙控器關閉身後的車門，兩人都陷入黑暗。

en: The garage windows have been covered with pieces of cardboard taped into place.
zh: 車庫窗戶都用硬紙板密封著。

en: “Nosy neighbors,” Hans says.
zh: 「熱衷流言蜚語的鄰居。」漢斯說。

en: “The rest of the place the same way?”
zh: 「別的地方也一樣嗎？」

en: “Not all of it, no,” Hans says, opening the car door.
zh: 「不是所有的，不是。」漢斯說著打開車門，車內燈亮了起來。

en: “Have I been here before?”
zh: 「難道我以前來過這裏？」

en: “Not here, no.
zh: 「你沒來過這裏，沒有。

en: I only moved in six months ago.”
zh: 我半年前才搬過來。」

en: They get out of the car.
zh: 他們下了車。

en: Jerry grabs his plastic bag and Hans flicks on the garage light so Jerry can follow without walking into a lawn mower or shelf. They head into the house.
zh: 傑瑞拿起購物袋，漢斯打開車庫裡的燈，這樣傑瑞就可以跟上他，不至於碰到割草機或儲物架。

en: “You’ve been here six months and you don’t have a dining table?” Jerry asks.
zh: 「你搬來半年了，就沒有買張餐桌？」傑瑞問。

en: “You want to discuss the way I live, or what we’re going to do about your situation?”
zh: 「你是想來討論我生活的方式，還是來處理你的事？」

en: “Fair point,” Jerry says.
zh: 「有道理。」傑瑞說。

en: They head into the lounge. There’s a TV and a couch and nothing else, no coffee table, no bookcase, no pictures on the walls.
zh: 他們走進客廳，客廳里除了一台電視機和一張沙發外別無他物，沒有茶几，沒有書櫃，牆壁上沒有任何壁畫或照片。

en: He imagines Hans sitting in here watching TV while his dinner plate rests on his legs.
zh: 他可以想象出漢斯把餐盤放在腿上，坐在這裏一邊吃東西一邊看電視的場景。

en: No wonder he hasn’t had a girlfriend stick around longer than two months.
zh: 難怪都過了兩個多月他一直沒有女朋友。

en: Jerry sits on the couch and Hans disappears then comes back thirty seconds later carrying a wooden stool. He places it opposite Jerry and sits down.
zh: 傑瑞坐在沙發上，接著漢斯走開了，三十秒后他回來了，拿了一個木凳。

en: He can’t remember the last time he ate.
zh: 他不記得上一次吃東西是在什麼時候了。

en: It’s chicken and ham with tomato. He picks out the tomato and offers it to Hans who shakes his head. He dumps it back into the bag.
zh: 他把番茄挑出來，遞給漢斯，漢斯搖搖頭，他便把它放回購物袋裡。

en: Hans switches on the TV to a news channel and puts it on mute.
zh: 漢斯打開電視，切換到新聞頻道，而後又把電視設置成靜音。

en: “When the police come knocking on my door,” Hans says, “and they will, I’m going to—”
zh: 「要是警察來敲我的門……」漢斯說，「他們會的，我會——」

en: “I thought you said they wouldn’t be able to make out the license plate of the car?”
zh: 「我還以為你要說他們查不出你的車牌號呢。」

en: “They’re going to cross-reference people you know with vehicles they own, but this address isn’t the same address my car is registered to. So that gives us time.
zh: 「他們會比對你熟人的車，不過這個地址不是我的車註冊時使用的地址，所以這就給了我們時間。

en: My guess is we have a couple of hours then we have to hit the road.
zh: 我的猜測是我們還有幾個小時，然後我們就要出發了。

en: You have two hours to figure out where this journal of yours is.”
zh: 你有兩個小時來想出日記在哪裡。」

en: “I already know where it is,” Jerry says, and he’s been thinking about it the entire drive here.
zh: 「我已經知道它在哪裡了。」傑瑞說，在開車的路上他一直在考慮這個問題，「在房子的新主人那裡，他在地板下發現了那本日記，出於某種原因，他希望保留它。」

en: “And what reason would that be?”
zh: 「出於什麼原因呢？」

en: Hans asks.
zh: 漢斯問。

en: “I haven’t figured that bit out yet.”
zh: 「這一點我還沒有想通。」

en: “Okay, so let’s keep that as a possibility. But I want you to consider something else. I want you to think about where else you could have hidden it.
zh: 「好吧，咱們權當有這種可能性，但我也希望你考慮一下別的可能性，比如我希望你想一想你還有可能把它放在哪裡。

en: That’s what you need to figure out now, Jerry.
zh: 這就是你現在需要考慮的問題，傑瑞。

en: Where else can we look?”
zh: 我們還能上哪裡去找呢？」

en: “Okay,” Jerry says. “And once we find it, we read it, and we go to the police no matter what it says, okay?”
zh: 「一旦我們找到了它，就要好好讀讀，然後去警察局，不管那上面寫些什麼，好嗎？」

en: “Gary has it.”
zh: 「在加里那裡。」

en: “Okay, Jerry?”
zh: 「想出來了，傑瑞？」

en: “Yes, fine, okay.”
zh: 「是的，嗯，我想出來了。」

en: “Think about where else you could have hidden it.”
zh: 「想想你還有沒有可能把它藏在別的什麼地方？」

en: Jerry takes another bite from the sandwich. “Fine, I’ll think about that, but we also need to figure out who would want to frame me,” he says, talking with a mouth half full.
zh: 傑瑞又咬一口三明治說：「好吧，我會好好想想的，但我們還需要弄清楚是誰想栽贓誣陷我。」

en: Hans shakes his head. Then he sighs. Then he looks at his watch and then he shifts a little on the stool.
zh: 漢斯搖搖頭，嘆了口氣，接著看了看自己的手錶，在凳子上來回晃動了一下。

en: Then he says, “Fine. Then let’s think about that. Do you have any suggestions?”
zh: 他說：「很好，那麼讓我們來思考一下，你有什麼看法？」

en: Jerry puts the last bit of sandwich into his mouth. He hits a piece of tomato he’d missed on his earlier pass through. He perseveres and chews on, and he thinks about who would want to frame him, and then he lets Henry Cutter think about it too.
zh: 傑瑞把最後一點兒三明治放到嘴裏，又把之前遞給漢斯的那塊番茄塞到嘴裏咀嚼著，心想誰會栽贓誣陷他。

en: In fact he lets Henry do all the thinking because Henry’s got the better mind for it and, sure enough, Henry comes up with an answer.
zh: 他讓亨利·卡特也思考這個問題。他之所以讓亨利思考這個問題，是因為亨利頭腦更敏銳，果然，亨利想出了一個答案。

en: It’s the guy, Henry says. Gary is the one framing you. “It’s Gary,” Jerry says.
zh: 「是那個傢伙，」亨利說，「是加里在栽贓誣陷你。」

en: “He found the journal, and I’ve obviously written enough in there for him to realize I can’t remember things, so now he’s killing women and leaving me at the scene.
zh: 「他發現了日記，我的日記寫得很詳細，他一定知道我不記得任何事情了，所以他殺害了那些女人，並且留下我的痕迹。

en: The shirt under the floorboards was probably one of his.”
zh: 地板下面的襯衫很可能是他的。」

en: “Jesus, Jerry, can you even hear how ridiculous that sounds?”
zh: 「天啊，傑瑞，你不知道這聽起來有多荒謬可笑！」

en: Yeah, my bad, Jerry. That was a bit of a stretch.
zh: 「是啊，是我不好，傑瑞，這麼說有點兒誇張。」

en: “Forgetting about the fact that I dropped you off at home that night, and I saw you wearing that bloody shirt, how does he do it?”
zh: 「難道你忘了那天晚上我送你回家，我看到你穿著那件該死的血襯衫，他是怎麼做到的？」

en: Hans asks, carrying on. “He waits outside the nursing home every night in a van hoping you’re going to escape? Then, the times you do, he picks you up, kills somebody in front of you, you take a nap and wake up and forget where you are? Then conveniently forget everything leading up to it?”
zh: 漢斯問，他又接著說，「他每天晚上都開著一輛麵包車在療養院外等著，準備讓你出逃？然後你出逃的時候，他接應你，在你面前殺死一個人，你打個盹，醒來，忘了你在哪裡，忘了所有一切？」

en: Jerry doesn’t answer him.
zh: 傑瑞沒有回答他。

en: “Do you have any idea how that sounds?” Hans asks.
zh: 「你知道這個論斷聽起來像什麼？」漢斯問。

en: Again Jerry doesn’t answer him.
zh: 傑瑞還是沒有回答。

en: “Okay, so let’s say some version of that is true, then why?”
zh: 「好吧，咱們假設有些論斷是真的，那麼是為什麼呢？」

en: “Because he can’t fake it,” Jerry says.
zh: 「因為他不會編造。」傑瑞說。

en: “What?”
zh: 「什麼？」

en: “He’s trying to be a writer. He wants to be like me.
zh: 「他想成為作家，他要成為像我一樣的作家。

en: Only so far all he has is a room full of rejection slips.”
zh: 只是到目前為止，他得到的只是滿滿一屋子退稿通知單。」

en: Jerry looks at the TV. There’s footage of bags of tightly wrapped cannabis and a bunch of police officers talking to people, footage of officers searching a house, of people being put into cuffs.
zh: 傑瑞看著電視，畫面上是一袋袋緊緊包裹著的大麻，一幫警察在和人們談話，他們搜查房屋，有人被戴上手銬。

en: The cops have put a dent in the nightlife of partygoers across the city, forcing the teenagers heading into town to damage their livers on alcohol now that all that weed has been confiscated.
zh: 警察在全市對城市派對的夜生活進行管制，迫使青少年湧入鄉鎮，況且現在所有的大麻已被沒收。

en: He remembers he once wrote a book about a gang who sold meth to high school kids. It didn’t end well for any of the characters.
zh: 他記得他曾經寫過一本關於一個團伙向中學生兜售冰毒的書，故事里每個人物都沒有好下場。

en: Is that where he’s heading now? To one of Henry Cutter’s bad endings?
zh: 他現在就要這樣嗎，接受亨利·卡特的書裏面的下場？

en: “The biggest piece of advice I give people is write what you know, and fake the rest.
zh: 「我給人們最多的建議就是：寫下你知道的，其餘的都可以編造。

en: There’s only so much research you can do. There’s only so far you can get into somebody else’s head.”
zh: 你可以進行資料研究，可以探究別人的思想。」

en: “I remember,” Hans says.
zh: 「我記得。」漢斯說。

en: “Gary is killing these women so he knows how it feels, what they feel, what the whole thing looks like.
zh: 「加里殺害了那些女人，所以他會知道那是什麼體驗，知道她們的感受，知道整個事情的狀態。

en: It’s research.
zh: 這就是研究，這就是調查。

en: He can make his fictional world believable.”
zh: 他可以讓他的虛構世界更加真實可信。」

en: “There are a million crime writers out there, buddy.
zh: 「犯罪小說家成千上萬啊，夥計。

en: Look, Jerry, let me be honest here—what you’re saying just doesn’t add up.”
zh: 說實話，傑瑞，你的論斷太不合乎情理了。」

en: Jerry knows it doesn’t. Of course he knows that. But throw a drowning man a brick and tell him it’ll float and he’ll pray to God you’re right.
zh: 傑瑞知道他的話不合乎情理，他當然知道，只是如果給一個溺水的人扔一塊磚，告訴他磚會浮起來，他也會向上天祈禱你說的是對的。

en: “And the blood on your clothes today?” Hans asks.
zh: 「那怎麼解釋今天你的衣服上有血跡？」漢斯問。

en: “He put it there.”
zh: 「是他弄上去的。」

en: “And the plastic bag in your pocket?”
zh: 「口袋裡的塑料袋呢？」

en: “Okay, fine, so it’s not him,” Jerry concedes.
zh: 「好吧，好吧，不是他。」傑瑞承認，「但肯定有個人，對吧？

en: “But it’s somebody, right? Because I’m not that guy. I can’t be that guy you see on the front page of the paper, the sick, twisted pervert who hurts women.
zh: 因為我不是那種人，我不是你在報紙頭版看到的變態，專門傷害女人。

en: I can’t be that guy, and if you don’t trust me, then trust Sandra.
zh: 我不是那種人，如果你不相信我，那麼總該相信桑德拉吧？

en: She would never have married somebody who could become that guy.”
zh: 她永遠不會和有可能成為這種變態的人結婚。」

en: Hans rubs his hand back over his scalp.
zh: 漢斯用手撓著頭皮。

en: “You do make a good point,” he says, “and I have to give you marks for trying.
zh: 「你說得有道理。」他說，「我同意你嘗試一下。

en: But everything you say can be contradicted by the fact you have Alzheimer’s.
zh: 不過你所說的一切都和你患有老年痴呆症的事實相矛盾，這隻是可能的因素之一。

en: It’s a wild card. I know you want to think differently, but it does make you a different person.”
zh: 我知道你的想法和常人不一樣，但這隻會讓你變得與他人格格不入。」

en: “But it doesn’t make me a killer.
zh: 「但這並沒有讓我成為殺人犯。

en: People don’t just wake up one day wanting to kill people.
zh: 人們醒來后，並不是總想著去殺人。

en: There has to be something wrong with them, something fundamentally wrong in their past.
zh: 他們肯定是出了什麼問題，以前犯過什麼根本性的錯誤。

en: The guy who bought my house, maybe he’s innocent in all of this, but I still think he has my journal.
zh: 那個買我房子的人，也許他是無辜的，但我仍然認為他拿了我的日記。

en: We need to make him talk.”
zh: 我們需要讓他說實話。」

en: “And how are you going to do that?
zh: 「那你打算怎麼做？

en: You going to torture some poor guy on the hunch of a man who five days a week wakes up forgetting his own name?”
zh: 你真的要憑著你的直覺折磨那個可憐的男人，哪怕你每周有五天醒來都會忘了自己的名字？」

en: Jerry doesn’t answer him.
zh: 傑瑞沒有回答他。

en: “And this guy, does he have a wife?”
zh: 「那傢伙，他有老婆嗎？」

en: “I think so.”
zh: 「我想有吧。」

en: “You want to tie her up too so she can’t go for help?
zh: 「你想把她也綁起來，這樣她就不能去求救嗎？

en: Threaten to kill her in front of her husband?
zh: 威脅她說要在她丈夫面前殺死她？

en: Cut her fingers off until he tells you where the diary is?
zh: 剁掉她的手指，直到他告訴你日記在哪裡？

en: Kill him if you have to, even though you’re not a killer?”
zh: 就算你不是殺人犯，如有必要你也會殺了她？」

en: “Okay,” Hans says, “okay.
zh: 「好吧。」漢斯說，「好吧。

en: Look, you said you can’t be a killer, because if you were there’d be something fundamentally wrong in your past, right?”
zh: 你看，你說你不是殺手，因為如果你是的話，那麼你以前肯定犯了某個根本性的錯誤，對嗎？」

en: “What about Suzan with a z?”
zh: 「對。」「那蘇姍呢？」

en: “She’s not real,” Jerry says.
zh: 「她不是真的。」傑瑞說。

en: Hans shakes his head. “She is real, mate.”
zh: 漢斯搖搖頭，說：「她確有其人，夥計。」

en: “Don’t say that,” Jerry says. “It’s not funny.”
zh: 「別這麼說，」傑瑞說，「這不好笑。」

en: “No, it’s not funny at all, and the last thing I wanted to do was tell you this, but you’re really leaving me no choice here.
zh: 「對，這不好笑，我也很想告訴你這一點，但你真的讓我別無選擇。

en: She lived a few doors down from the house you lived in for six months when your other place was being fixed up.
zh: 你家裡進行修繕時曾搬到別的地方住了六個月，她住的房子和你住的地方只隔了幾戶人家。

en: Her real name was Julia Barnes and I think you killed her.”
zh: 她的真名是朱莉婭·巴恩斯，我認為你殺了她。」
